etymology.description: Depicts a pipe -> later added decorative 口 (kǒu, "mouth") -> evolved into 筒(tóng, "pipe")
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicting a pipe, 同(tóng) was likely visualized as a cylindrical object. The later addition of 口(kǒu, "mouth") to the character may have been decorative or added to emphasize cooperation or messages passed through a pipe, thus associating it with the idea of togetherness or communication.

examples.chinese: 我们同享美食(我們同享美食)。
他和我目光相同(他和我目光相同)，心意一致(心意一致)。
examples.pinyin: Tā hé wǒ mùguāng xiāngtóng, xīnyì yīzhì.
examples.english: He and I have the same perspective, and our hearts are in agreement.
